importantDates.descriptionOfWhyDateIsRelevant: The date when Biden completed his course of radiation therapy, marking a key milestone in his cancer treatment journey.

importantTimeframes.descriptionOfWhyTimeFrameIsRelevant: The period during which Biden began his initial treatment plan, including a pill regimen and radiation therapy, following his diagnosis in May.

keyTakeAways: Former President Joe Biden has completed a full course of radiation therapy for prostate cancer, which had previously spread to his bones.
Biden began a pill regimen earlier this year and underwent Mohs surgery for skin cancer earlier this month.
The treatment was administered at Penn Medicine Radiation Oncology in Philadelphia, where Biden's daughter Ashley posted a video of him ringing the treatment bell.
Biden’s spokesperson confirmed he has been diagnosed with an aggressive form of prostate cancer that had spread to bones, but expressed optimism about the prognosis.
Biden remains active in public life, with plans to speak at events in Boston and Omaha, indicating ongoing public engagement despite his health challenges.

summaryOfNewsArticle: Former President Joe Biden has completed a full course of radiation therapy for an aggressive form of prostate cancer that had spread to his bones. The treatment, administered at Penn Medicine Radiation Oncology in Philadelphia, follows earlier medical interventions such as a pill regimen and Mohs surgery for skin cancer. His daughter Ashley shared updates through social media, including a video of him ringing the treatment bell, emphasizing both medical progress and personal resilience. Despite his health challenges, Biden remains active in public life, with upcoming speaking engagements in Boston and Omaha, underscoring his continued role in national politics and public discourse.
title: Biden completes a course of radiation therapy for cancer treatment
